column1.content:
Book tickets

Some good seats available at mid-week performances

Book direct with the
Lyceum Theatre Box Office Book direct with

Call the Lyceum Theatre box office

0844 871 3000

Calls cost 7p per min, plus your phone company’s access charge

Book tickets in person

Lyceum Theatre

column2.content:
Performance Information

Tuesday to
Saturday

2:30pm

Wednesdays, Saturdays & Sundays

Performance length:
2.5 hours including interval

To make your visit as safe as possible,
security checks are in place at the
Lyceum Theatre

Find out more to help plan your visit

items.question: Bring a Group of 10 or more
items.answer:
Group bookings are currently available on selected seats and performances until September 2019.

Groups 10-24

£49.50
Stalls & Royal Circle

£39.50
Grand Circle

Groups 25-49

£45.00
Stalls & Royal Circle

£35.00
Grand Circle

Groups 50+

£39.50
Stalls & Royal Circle

£29.50
Grand Circle

Group rate available for Tuesday to Friday performances only. Unavailable during school holiday periods. From 2 July 2019 to 30 August 2019 higher group rates apply and only some Wednesday, Thursday and certain Friday performances are eligible.

Book with Groupline
Click here

Or call Group Line on 020 7206 1174
Calls are charged at your network provider’s standard local rate

Book direct with Disney
Complete this form

Or call Disney Tickets on 0800 640 8101
Calls are free of charge from a landline, or charged at your network provider’s standard local rate on mobile

Read our terms and conditions

items.question: Access Concessions
items.answer:
There are concessionary rates for guests with certain access requirements. These can either be booked over the phone on 0800 912 6972, in person at the Box Office, or by emailing Lyceumboxoffice@theambassadors.com. Concessions are subject to availability.

Throughout the year there are a range of performances with enhanced accessibility, such as signed, captioned and audio described performances.

Click here for upcoming access performance dates and to read more about access facilities at the theatre.

items.question: Day Seats
items.answer:
A limited number of Day Seats priced at £20 per ticket are available to purchase each morning in person at the Lyceum Theatre Box Office.

Each person is allowed to purchase a maximum of two tickets each. Subject to availability.

items.question: Bring a School Group
items.answer:
Over one million pupils have already experienced THE LION KING through its award-winning EDUCATION PROGRAMME. Combined with seeing the production, this programme will take your pupils on an engaging journey that they will never forget.

Developed by teachers, for teachers, the programme is fully curriculum linked to support subjects at KS2 and 3 and is easily adaptable.

All of the resources are available for free on a brand new online hub, the easy to use search tool allows you to discover activities and lesson plans that are relevant for your classroom.

Education Resources

Book now for selected performances until September 2019.

STANDARD PRICING

Standard pricing applies to performances until July 2019

£29.50
Stalls & Royal Circle

£22.50
Grand Circle

OFF-PEAK PRICING

Off-peak pricing applies to performances in September 2019

£25
Stalls & Royal Circle

£19.50
Grand Circle

Plus one teacher goes free with every ten paid tickets.

Available Tuesday - Thursday at 7:30pm performances and Wednesday matinee performances at 2:30pm. Unavailable during school holiday periods. University and Full Time Education Group rates are also available. Please see terms and conditions for details.

Book with Groupline
Click here

Or call Group Line on 020 7206 1174
Calls are charged at your network provider’s standard local rate

Book direct with Disney
Complete this form

Or call Disney Tickets on 0800 640 8101
Calls are free of charge from a landline, or charged at your network provider’s standard local rate on mobile

Read our terms and conditions

items.question: Senior Group Rates
items.answer:
Senior groups of 10+ pay £35.00 per ticket for best available Stalls or Royal Circle seats for Wednesday (matinee and evening) performances only.

Plus one group organiser goes free with every ten paid tickets.

Book with Groupline

Or call Group Line on 020 7206 1174
Calls are charged at your network provider’s standard local rate

title: About the Show
metaDescription: Watch the trailer and latest videos from The Lion King on the official Disney website.

bgImageTextBlock.text:
Disney’s award-winning musical THE LION KING explodes with glorious colours, stunning effects and enchanting music. It follows the powerful story of Simba as he journeys from wide-eyed cub to his destined role as King of the Pridelands.

Now in its 20th year at London's Lyceum Theatre, visionary director Julie Taymor’s acclaimed reimagining of Disney's beloved film will redefine your expectation of theatre.

title: Cast & Creatives
metaDescription: Find out more about the cast and creatives of The Lion King, London’s Landmark Musical, and buy tickets from the official Disney website.

title: Your Visit
metaDescription: Get answers to frequently asked questions about your visit to THE LION KING on the official Disney website.

textBlockFullWidth.content:
How do I get there?

Lyceum Theatre
21 Wellington Street
London WC2E 7RQ

Click to check your route

items.title: Underground & Train
items.content:
The nearest stations are:

  • Charing Cross – Network South East
  • Waterloo and Waterloo East – Bakerloo, Northern and Jubilee Lines
  • Covent Garden – Piccadilly Line
  • Temple – Circle & District Lines
  • Leicester Square – Piccadilly and Northern Lines
  • Charing Cross – Bakerloo, Norther and Jubilee Lines
  • Holborn – Piccadilly and Central Lines
  • Embankment – Bakerloo, Northern, and District & Circle Lines

items.title: Bus
items.content: To reach the theatre by bus, use numbers 1, 6, 9, 11, 13, 15, 23, 68, 77A, 91, 176 or 341 with Leicester Square as the destination. The closest bus interchange for all London routes and night buses is Trafalgar Square.

items.title: Parking
items.content:
You can save 50% with Q-Park’s Theatreland Parking Scheme. Click here for full details.

The nearest NCP car parks are on Parker Street, Museum Street, Holborn and the St. Martin’s Lane Hotel.

items.title: Cycle
items.content: There is a self-hire bike docking station directly outside the theatre, provided by Transport for London. Click here for details

items.question: How long is the show?
items.answer: The performance lasts approximately 2 hours and 30 minutes including an interval.

items.question: Is there a minimum age requirement to attend the show?
items.answer:
THE LION KING is recommended for a general audience. We recommend THE LION KING for ages 6 and up. Children under the age of 3 will not be admitted into the theatre.

All persons aged 16 or under must be accompanied by an adult and may not sit on their own within the auditorium.

All persons entering the theatre, regardless of age, must have a ticket.

items.question: What should I wear?
items.answer: There is no dress code at the theatre. For all performances, attire should be comfortable and appropriate for the occasion.

items.question: Does the show use any special effects?
items.answer: THE LION KING contains theatrical smoke and fog effects as well as strobe lighting during parts of the show.

items.question: How can I audition to be in the show
items.answer: For information about auditioning click here.

items.question: Does THE LION KING offer day seats?
items.answer: A limited number of Day Seats priced at £20 per ticket are available to purchase each morning in person at the Lyceum Theatre Box Office. Each person is allowed to purchase a maximum of two tickets each. Subject to availability.

items.question: I have a question about my booking, who can I contact?
items.answer:
If you booked through Tickets, please click here for more information.

If you booked via ATG Tickets or the Lyceum Theatre Box Office, please click here.

If you booked elsewhere, please contact your point of purchase.

items.question: Is official THE LION KING merchandise available to purchase at the theatre?
items.answer: Merchandise is available to purchase before and after the show, and during the interval across a number of locations inside the theatre. You can pay for merchandise with either cash or credit/debit card – all card types are accepted. For pre-orders or for any other enquiries contact merchandise@disneytheatrical.co.uk.

items.question: How do I contact someone at THE LION KING?
items.answer:
If you would like to write to a member of the cast please send a letter to:
[Cast member Name]
The Lyceum Theatre
21 Wellington Street
London, WC2E 7RQ
Please note that we cannot guarantee that all letters will receive a response.

To reach the Disney Theatrical Group press office, submit your request here.

To discover employment opportunities with Disney Theatrical Group, visit Disney Careers.

items.question: Are there cloakroom facilities available?
items.answer: Cloakroom facilities are available for coats and umbrellas, however we are unable to accept large bags and luggage. We strongly advise that you do not bring large bags to the theatre.

title: Access
metaDescription: Find out about access performances, wheelchair and hearing facilities at THE LION KING, London’s Landmark Musical, on the official Disney website.

items.question: How do I find out about access facilities at the theatre?
items.answer:
The Lyceum Theatre is fully accessible to disabled, deaf and visually impaired guests. THE LION KING is committed to making your experience as easy and enjoyable as possible.


If you have any specific requirements / questions please call 0800 912 6972 or email Lyceumboxoffice@theambassadors.com.

items.question: Are there facilities for people with visual impairments?
items.answer:
THE LION KING regularly schedules audio described performances for those with visual impairments in association with Vocal Eyes. Audio description in theatre is a live verbal commentary on the visual elements of a production, delivered as a performance unfolds, through a discreet headset.

The next audio described performances of THE LION KING will take place on Wednesday 20th March 2019 at 7: 30pm./p>

Guide Dogs are welcome in the auditorium or can alternatively be left in the care of theatre staff. If you intend to bring a guide dog, please let your sales advisor know at the time of booking.

The Lyceum Theatre has a limited number of large print and Braille programmes available. Please contact the Front of House Manager in advance on 020 7420 8100 (calls charged at local rate) to request a copy.

A copy of THE LION KING script is available in braille and an appointment can be made to read it in the theatre by calling 020 7420 8100 (calls charged at local rate) in advance.

items.question: Are there facilities for people with hearing impairments?
items.answer:
THE LION KING regularly schedules sign-interpreted performances in association with Theatre Sign. Throughout the performance, a qualified theatre sign interpreter stands on the left of the stage and uses sign language to relay music and words to deaf and hearing impaired patrons, all of whom are seated within easy viewing distance of both the stage and interpreter.

The next signed performances will take place on Tuesday 30th April 2019 at 7:30pm.

We regularly schedule captioned performances of THE LION KING in association with Stagetext. Captioning is a way of converting the spoken word into visible text that provides deaf, deafened and hard of hearing people with access to live performance.

The next captioned performance of THE LION KING will take place on Wednesday 27th March 2019 at 7:30pm.

items.question: When is the next assisted performance?
items.answer:
The next ‘Stagetext’ captioned performance of THE LION KING will take place on Wednesday 27th March 2019 at 7:30pm.


The next ‘Vocaleyes’ audio described performances of THE LION KING will take place on Wednesday 20th March 2019 at 7:30pm.


The next ‘Theatre Sign’ signed performances will take place on Tuesday 30th April 2019 at 7:30pm. Please note, this performance will be on sale towards the end of 2018.


It is advisable to book for these performances well in advance as tickets are subject to availability.

items.question: How do I book access concessions?
items.answer: Disabled, deaf and visually impaired concessions can either be booked over the phone on 0800 912 6972, in person at the Box Office, or by emailing Lyceumboxoffice@theambassadors.com. Concessions are subject to availability.

items.question: Is the theatre accessible for wheelchair users?
items.answer:
There are eight wheelchair spaces available in the Stalls seating area.


The wheelchair accessible entrance is via a double exit door situated at the front of the theatre on Wellington Street. This is clearly marked and provides level access to the Accessible Toilets, the Stalls Bar and the Stalls seating area.


The theatre’s main entrance is up three steps to the lower foyer. From here there are 7 steps down to the Stalls and 12 steps up to the Royal Circle landing. The Grand Circle is up 83 steps.


There are lift facilities available to all levels of the Lyceum Theatre, located via the entrance on Exeter Street. All levels, apart from the Stalls, are laid out over a number of steps.

items.question: Are there disabled parking spaces close to the theatre?
items.answer:
There are parking spaces for blue badge holders close to the theatre.

The nearest car parks are located in Chinatown and Leicester Square and can be booked in advance by calling Qpark on 0800 243 348

Tickets for the Theatreland parking scheme can be validated within the Lyceum Theatre. This can be done in the foyer cloakroom.

items.question: Does THE LION KING schedule relaxed performances?
items.answer: The Lion King will host a Relaxed Performance in June 2019. Click here for more information.

items.question: Are there any resources available to help prepare for my visit?
items.answer:
Watch the video visual story below to learn what you will experience when you arrive at the Lyceum Theatre.



You can also download a PDF copy of the Lyceum Theatre visual story here.

column1.content:
EDUCATION

Education Group Rates up to Year 13

Education group sales currently available on selected seats and performances until September 2019, excluding school holiday periods and additional black-out dates as determined by Disney in its sole discretion. Valid for Tuesday to Thursday evenings and Wednesday matinee performances only. Rate applies for groups of 10+ (primary or secondary school pupils up to and including Year 13). Groups pay £29.50 per ticket in the Stalls & Royal Circle and £22.50 in Grand Circle for the same performance. For off-peak performances in September 2019, groups pay £25 per ticket in the Stalls & Royal Circle and £19.50 in Grand Circle for the same performance. For every ten (10) paid tickets, Group receives one (1) free ticket for use by a teacher. Education group tickets purchased shall not be offered for re-sale via social media channels to individual members, unless otherwise agreed in writing by The Walt Disney Company and all attendees must be from the same University or education group (we reserve the right to verify these details at the theatre). Offer is subject to availability and may be revoked at any time. All sales final. No refunds or exchanges permitted. Prices, dates, times and cast subject to change without notice. Once issued, tickets cannot be replaced if lost, stolen or destroyed and is only valid for the event for which it is issued. The unlawful resale or attempted resale of the ticket is grounds for seizure and cancellation without compensation. Holder agrees, by the use of the ticket, not to transmit or aid in transmitting any description, account, picture, or reproduction of the show. Holder grants permission to Disney to use the holder’s image or likeness in connection with any live or recorded video or other transmission of the show. Children under the age of 3 will not be admitted to the theatre. All persons aged 16 or under must be accompanied by an adult and may not sit on their own in the auditorium.

Education Group Rates for University and Full Time Education Groups

University and Full Time Education group sales currently available on selected seats and performances until September 2019, excluding school holiday periods and additional black-out dates as determined by Disney in its sole discretion. Valid for Tuesday to Thursday evenings and Wednesday matinee performances only. Groups of 10+ (post Year 13) pay £33.50 per ticket in the Stalls & Royal Circle and £29.50 in Grand Circle for the same performance. For every ten (10) paid tickets, Group receives one (1) free ticket free for use by a teacher. Education group tickets purchased shall not be offered for re-sale via social media channels to individual members, unless agreed in writing by The Walt Disney Company. Offer is subject to availability and may be revoked at any time. All sales final. No refunds or exchanges permitted. Prices, dates, times and cast subject to change without notice. Once issued, tickets cannot be replaced if lost, stolen or destroyed and is only valid for the event for which it is issued. The unlawful resale or attempted resale of the ticket is grounds for seizure and cancellation without compensation. Holder agrees, by the use of the ticket, not to transmit or aid in transmitting any description, account, picture, or reproduction of the show. Holder grants permission to Disney to use the holder’s image or likeness in connection with any live or recorded video or other transmission of the show. Children under the age of 3 will not be admitted to the theatre. All persons aged 16 or under must be accompanied by an adult and may not sit on their own in the auditorium

For every ten (10) paid tickets, Group receives one (1) free ticket free for use by a group organiser. Senior Citizen group tickets purchased shall not be offered for re-sale via social media channels to individual members, unless agreed in writing by The Walt Disney Company. Offer is subject to availability and may be revoked at any time. All sales final. No refunds or exchanges permitted. Prices, dates, times and cast subject to change without notice. Once issued, tickets cannot be replaced if lost, stolen or destroyed and is only valid for the event for which it is issued. The unlawful resale or attempted resale of the ticket is grounds for seizure and cancellation without compensation. Holder agrees, by the use of the ticket, not to transmit or aid in transmitting any description, account, picture, or reproduction of the show. Holder grants permission to Disney to use the holder’s image or likeness in connection with any live or recorded video or other transmission of the show. Children under the age of 3 will not be admitted to the theatre. All persons aged 16 or under must be accompanied by an adult and may not sit on their own in the auditorium.

Bristol Hippodrome | Autumn 2019

Tickets for Bristol will go on sale in February 2019 - sign-up now for priority access to tickets below.

Holder agrees, by the use of the ticket, not to transmit or aid in transmitting any description, account, picture, or reproduction of the show. Holder grants permission to Disney to use the holder’s image or likeness in connection with any live or recorded video or other transmission of the show. Children under the age of 3 will not be admitted to the theatre. All persons aged 16 or under must be accompanied by an adult and may not sit on their own in the auditorium.

Senior Citizens Group Sales Terms and Conditions

Senior Citizens group rates currently available on selected seats and performances until September 2019, excluding school holiday periods and additional black-out dates as determined by Disney in its sole discretion. Valid for Wednesday matinee and evening performances only. Groups of 10+ pay £35.00 per ticket in the Stalls & Royal Circle for the same performance. For every ten (10) paid tickets, Group receives one (1) free ticket free for use by a group organiser. Senior Citizen group tickets purchased shall not be offered for re-sale via social media channels to individual members, unless agreed in writing by The Walt Disney Company. Offer is subject to availability and may be revoked at any time. All sales final. No refunds or exchanges permitted. Prices, dates, times and cast subject to change without notice. Once issued, tickets cannot be replaced if lost, stolen or destroyed and is only valid for the event for which it is issued. The unlawful resale or attempted resale of the ticket is grounds for seizure and cancellation without compensation. Holder agrees, by the use of the ticket, not to transmit or aid in transmitting any description, account, picture, or reproduction of the show. Holder grants permission to Disney to use the holder’s image or likeness in connection with any live or recorded video or other transmission of the show. Children under the age of 3 will not be admitted to the theatre. All persons aged 16 or under must be accompanied by an adult and may not sit on their own in the auditorium.
